New Saigon Blonde Bar Aims to Be "An Escape" in the Burg We use cookies to give you the best experience on our site. Learn more or close to accept. √ó Skip to content Stories Guides Events Visitors Tours Merch Stories Guides Events Visitors Tours Merch Search Search COMMUNITY PARTNER Biz , Burg New Saigon Blonde Bar Aims to Be ‚ÄúAn Escape‚Äù in the Burg July 11, 2018 ‚Ä¢ By DuPont Octavius July 11, 2018 ‚Ä¢ By DuPont Octavius 136 SHARES Facebook Twitter Poised to launch on Central Avenue in the coming week, Saigon Blonde promises an immersive departure from the day-to-day bar experience.¬†Intentionally mixing history and fiction, the narrative look of the new bar features design elements like commissioned artwork and custom fixtures¬†to create ‚Äúa surreal setting unlike any other in the Tampa Bay area.‚Äù Throughout the bar, special consideration has been given to the role art and design play in telling the story of Saigon Blonde. Artwork is integral to the experience and much of it was created by local contemporary realist Jean Michael Fait. His commissioned series ‚ÄúA Libertine in Saigon ‚Äù expresses both the cultural value of the past as well as the importance of contemporary art and local entertainment. ADVERTISEMENT Despite its international inspiration, Saigon Blonde is already rooted in local culture. Offering a full bar throughout, its inventive cocktail menu, which boasts a serious lineup of tropical ingredients and flavors (rambutan pur√©e, for instance), sources produce from the local Farm Fresh Produce and the bar will have local selections from American Freedom Distillery, among others. In support of St. Pete‚Äôs recent move away from straws and other single-use plastics, the Saigon Blonde team is making decisions with their environmental footprint in mind. The disposable drinkware for the outdoor bar will be a plant-based bioplastic option, and straws will be paper and largely by request only. Like many other downtown establishments, they struggle with the lack of recycling services available, but are investigating other ways to decrease their environmental impact. Saigon Blonde will be located at 265 Central Ave. Rendering and logo courtesy of Saigon Blonde ADVERTISEMENT Subscribe Now Don‚Äôt miss out on All Things Good in the Burg üëâ Email Stay in the know üëá GET UPDATES üëá Stay connected to All Things Good in the Burg by subscribing today. Advertise with Forbes Forbes Licensing & Syndication Report a Security Issue Editorial Values and Standards Site Feedback Contact Us Careers at Forbes Tips Corrections Privacy Do Not Sell My Personal Information Terms AdChoices Reprints & Permissions Get in Touch Get In Touch With Richard Saghian Get In Touch PROFILE Richard Saghian $2.1B Real Time Net Worth as of 9/11/25 Reflects change since 5 pm ET of prior trading day. #1814 in the world today From the Editor Richard Saghian is the founder and CEO of fast fashion company Fashion Nova, which generates some $2 billion in annual sales. The son of Iranian immigrants, Saghian started the company in 2006 after dropping out of college. He offered hundreds of new clothing styles a week, promoted on Instagram by influencers and celebrities like Cardi B. In 2018, Fashion Nova was the most Googled fashion brand, beating out the likes of Louis Vuitton, Versace and Gucci. Saghian owns several properties in Los Angeles, including a sprawling hilltop estate in Bel Air that he purchased for $141 million. Wealth History HOVER TO REVEAL NET WORTH BY YEAR Forbes Lists #1688 Billionaires (2025) Personal Stats Age 44 Source of Wealth Fast fashion, Self Made Residence Los Angeles, California Citizenship United States Marital Status Single Education Drop Out, California State University Northridge Did you know Three men attempted to rob Saghian outside his home in 2021. A confrontation with a security guard led to gunfire, resulting in one fatality. Saghian was uninjured. In 2022, Fashion Nova agreed to pay $4.2 million to settle allegations by the FTC that it suppressed negative reviews online. Fashion Nova denies the allegations. I spoke to her about both. Hidden Saigon | About Us top of page INTRODUCING OUR CULTURE MAKERS INTRODUCING OUR CULTURE MAKERS Home Services Movers & Shakers Gallery About Us Press & Reviews Contact Us More... Use tab to navigate through the menu items. WE ARE HIDDEN SAIGON WHY WE DO IT Established in 2018 by Vietnamese-Canadian Linh Phan, Hidden Saigon aims to reshape how Vietnam is perceived globally , one individual at a time. ‚Äã Our focus is on sharing authentic stories that reflect the current essence of Vietnam, moving beyond the narrative of the War, ph·ªü, and b√°nh m√¨. ‚Äã We believe in letting the local community members tell their own stories, giving them the power to shape their representation. ‚Äã This approach allows us to capture the true essence of contemporary Vietnam. HOW WE DO IT We have built strong connections with the community through our efforts in various sectors such as media, music, nightlife, F&B, NGOs, and the arts over the past 18 years in Vietnam. ‚Äã By sharing a common vision and showing respect , we can engage in partnerships with businesses, creatives, and locals that many other companies may not have the opportunity to connect with. WHAT WE DO We offer a range of carefully curated activities for our guests, including journeys, workshops, events, commercial partnerships, and media production. ‚Äã Additionally, we host diverse community events like indie Vietnamese film screenings, panel discussions, and marketplaces to nurture and strengthen our relationships with them. RESPONSIBLE TOURISM At Hidden Saigon, we recognize that our actions can have both positive and negative effects on the lives of city residents. ‚Äã Prioritizing sensitivity to the community's needs: We collaborate closely with our partners to ensure their input is valued during development and feedback stages. ‚Äã To minimize negative impacts, we implement the following strategies: Limiting group sizes for our tours Including multiple locations in each journey package to distribute impact across various areas Minimizing plastic usage by encouraging guests to bring refillable water bottles and reusable bags. ABOUT THE FOUNDER: LINH PHAN A Creative Producer residing in Saigon for over 18 years A Refugee Boat person who departed Saigon in 1977 and was raised in Toronto, Canada A Partner in a media production company in Saigon for 5 years, specializing in community storytelling projects, art, and cultural content Engaged in various community initiatives such as the Street Art Festival and Digital Storytelling concerning health topics for marginalized groups Recipient of numerous International Grants Conducts and develops training workshops in digital storytelling, photovoice, and film production Works with a diverse clientele including commercial, government, and television broadcasters A DJ and Event Promoter for 15 years, hosting parties recognized in the Lonely Planet Guide Vietnam and Southeast Asia as one of the trendiest club nights in Ho Chi Minh City. STAY UP TO DATE Subscribe Success! Message received. Red Thread will serve up a culinary experience inspired by the Silk Road this fall We use cookies to give you the best experience on our site. Learn more or close to accept. √ó Skip to content Stories Guides Events Visitors Tours Merch Stories Guides Events Visitors Tours Merch Search Search COMMUNITY PARTNER Biz , Eat/Drink Red Thread will serve up a culinary experience inspired by the Silk Road this fall August 26, 2024 ‚Ä¢ By Aaron Styza August 26, 2024 ‚Ä¢ By Aaron Styza 56 SHARES Facebook Twitter St. Pete will soon welcome a new dining destination as Red Thread prepares to open at 300 1st Ave N this September. This restaurant, created by the team behind the popular Saigon Blonde bar, promises to take patrons on a culinary journey inspired by the ancient Silk Road. The team behind Leonard Contractors is overseeing the buildout. Red Thread offers an innovative dining experience that celebrates the diverse flavors and traditions of the historic trade routes connecting the East and West. The menu showcases an exquisite selection of dishes and craft cocktails, drawing inspiration from the cuisines of China, India, Persia, the Middle East, and the Mediterranean. ADVERTISEMENT A culinary journey along the Silk Road in St. Pete Red Thread‚Äôs chefs meticulously craft each dish to highlight the authentic spices, ingredients, and techniques exchanged for centuries along the ancient Silk Road. The restaurant‚Äôs name, ‚ÄúRed Thread,‚Äù nods to a myth from Chinese and Japanese folklore that symbolizes a predestined connection between individuals‚Äîa theme that resonates across various East Asian and Middle Eastern cultures. The owners, who have already made a name for themselves with the success of Saigon Blonde, bring a wealth of experience and passion to this new venture. Red Thread opens for brunch on weekends and offers lunch and dinner throughout the week. Guests can dine in a stylish indoor setting or on a picturesque private outdoor patio, which features an indoor/outdoor bar that seamlessly blends historical inspiration with modern luxury. The highly anticipated opening of Red Thread is expected by the end of September. Tiki Bar: Saigon Blonde | mytiki.life Welcome to the mytiki.life v2 beta. This is a work in progress and there may be some bugs. If you find any issues or have feedback send me an email: [email¬†protected] . mytiki.life Home Tiki Mugs Swizzle Sticks Other Collectibles Collectors Creators Tiki Bars Home Tiki Bars Contact Request an update Sign in Create an account Search Quick Search Sign in Home Commercial Tiki Bars Saigon Blonde St. Petersburg, Florida, United States Add Visit Close Opened July of 2018. St. Petersburg local Peri Bandazian transformed the former LUX bar and lounge on Central Avenue into a tropical, immersive destination downtown.  Bandazian‚Äôs Saigon Blonde is inspired by ‚Äô60s-era Vietnam and while it has tiki elements, is not exactly a tiki bar in the strict sense.  It is best described as a fusion of 60s pop motifs centered around a quasi fictional background of Vietnam War era Saigon, wherein "The proprietor, a beautiful blonde of Vietnamese and French descent, had created an oasis for locals and soldiers alike." The narrative look of the new bar features design elements like commissioned artwork and custom fixtures to create ‚Äúa surreal setting unlike any other in the Tampa Bay area.‚Äù The owner partnered with Pinellas Park‚Äôs Creative Arts Unlimited, Inc. and St. Pete‚Äôs Wax & Hive to bring Saigon Blonde to life, and much of the art, which is a crucial component of the bar, was done by local contemporary realist Jean Michael Fait. Saigon Blonde has five distinct areas for patrons to enjoy ‚Äî showcasing symbolism and memorabilia, among other decorative details such as woven bamboo-covered walls and nods to folklore: 1) The outdoor walk-up bar. 2) The front bar with tiki totems and murals, plus an inventive cocktail menu that references the Pacific Rim in flavor and color. 3) Highlighting a sultry feel, the downstairs lounge with hanging lanterns, paintings and plush furniture. 4) Fashioned from an old plane wing, the intimate, dimly lit military bar toward the back. And 5) The VIP-like loft lounge ‚Äî accessed through a narrow staircase and around a bend to overlook the downstairs lounge and front bar ‚Äî with more plush furniture and a mural ceiling. *NOTE: They do have a sub-section of their cocktail menu that specializes in drinks with CBD oil or cannabis aromatics, and these additions can be added to their other cocktails as well.  Shown in last photo is their Hemp Day Cocktail with Marijuana leaf sprinkle stencil of aromatics. Details Type Bar Phone (727) 827-7577 Address St. Petersburg, Florida, United States Closed?
